Single Vessel Model documentation¶

Passive Case¶

class src.Perfusion_pass¶

Bases: object

Consumption(x, *params2)¶

This function calculates the Consumption as a function of axial distance along the length of the artery or vessel.

Parameters

  • x – The axial distance along the length of the vessel…

  • params2 – tuple of the constant parameters to the function which helps to calculate the ATP Consumption as a function of the axial distance.

Returns

ATP consumption as a function of the axial distance…

Consumption2(x, *params3)¶

This function calculates the Consumption as a function of axial distance along the length of the artery or vessel.

Parameters

  • x – The axial distance along the length of the vessel…

  • params3 – tuple of the constant parameters to the function which helps to calculate the ATP Consumption as a function of the axial distance.

Returns

ATP consumption as a function of the axial distance…

SCR(x, *params4)¶

This function calculates the Consumption as a function of axial distance along the length of the artery or vessel.

Parameters

  • x – The axial distance along the length of the vessel…

  • params4 – tuple of the constant parameters to the function which helps to calculate the SCR integral stimuli as a function of the axial distance.

Returns

SCR integral stimuli as a function of the axial distance…

Saturation(x, *params1)¶

This function calculates the Saturation as a function of x based on certain parameters..

Parameters

  • x – This is the distance along the length of the artery

  • params1 – Tuple of parameters which must be unpacked to release the individual elements.

Returns

Returns the saturation as a function of the axial distance along the length of the particular vessel.

Tension2(Diam, Pres)¶

This function is input into python routine - fsolve to calculate the Optimum Diameter for a particular pressure…

Parameters

  • Diam – This is the list which corresponds to the two different diameters of the large and small arteriole.

  • Pres – This is the pressure corresponding to a particular diameter

Returns

Returns the residual of the total tension subtracted from the myogenic tension for both sets of diameters.

Metabolic Case¶

class src.Perfusion_meta¶

Bases: object

Activation(Pres, Diam, flag, flag2)¶

This function calculates the activation for a particular set of Pressures and Diameters..

Parameters

  • Pres –

    type float

    This is the pressure which is input into the system for which the diameter is to be calculated..

  • Diam –

    type float

    This is the Diameter list which is to be input into the system

  • flag –

    type int

    1 or 2 to distinguish between large and small arteriole…

  • flag2 –

    type int

    1 or 2 or 3 or 4 for all cases, myogenic case, shear case and metabolic case…

Returns Activation
rtype float

The function also returns the metabolic/myogenic/shear stimuli for flag2=2/3/4 and flag = 1/2 for large and small arteriole.

Saturation(x, *params1)¶

This function calculates the Saturation as a function of x based on certain parameters..

Parameters

Returns

Returns the saturation as a function of the axial distance along the length of the particular vessel.

Tension2(Diam, Pres)¶

This function is input into python routine - fsolve to calculate the Optimum Diameter for a particular pressure…

Parameters

  • Diam – This is the list which corresponds to the two different diameters of the large and small arteriole.

  • Pres – This is the pressure corresponding to a particular diameter

Returns

Returns the residual of the total tension subtracted from the myogenic tension for both sets of diameters. In the form of a tuple of floats.
